message.content:
cs.CV, cs.RO, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.NE 

The paper deals with event cameras, a type of sensor used in robotics and computer vision. The proposed approach involves using existing computer vision techniques to process videos reconstructed from event data. Therefore, the most likely sub-category is cs.CV (Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition). The paper also discusses the application of the proposed approach to visual-inertial odometry, which falls under the sub-category cs.RO (Robotics). The use of recurrent networks for video reconstruction suggests a focus on machine learning, making cs.LG (Machine Learning) a likely sub-category. The paper also mentions the use of off-the-shelf computer vision algorithms, which could fall under cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence). Finally, the use of simulated event data for training the network suggests a focus on neural networks, making cs.NE (Neural and Evolutionary Computing) a possible sub-category.
